authorsByline: blisik, Brian Lisik | brianlisik@yahoo.com, Brian Lisik
title: Car struck by object while driving under overpass: Independence Police Blotter
description: Also in this week’s Independence Police blotter, a driver is arrested for OVI after nearly striking a police cruiser.
content:
A driver reported her car was struck by an unknown object while driving under a highway overpass at 5:15 a.m. July 26, shattering the car’s windshield. Police searched the overpass for suspects, but none were found. There was no further information at the time of the report.

A driver was arrested for operating a motor vehicle impaired at 11:51 p.m. July 25 after he reportedly drove past a police cruiser at a high rate of speed, nearly striking the cruiser. The driver was pulled over at Transportation Boulevard after being seen committing four marked-lanes violations. He failed field sobriety tests and later registered nearly three times the legal limit for intoxication.

Get police blotters by email every weekday for free with our new Police Blotter newsletter. Sign up at cleveland.com/newsletters.

Read more news from the Parma Sun Post.
summary: A driver reported her car was hit by an unknown object while driving under a highway overpass, causing it to shatter the windshield. The incident occurred at 5:15am. Police searched the overpass for any suspects, but no further information was released. A driver was arrested for operating a motor vehicle impaired after failing field sobriety tests and registering nearly three times the legal limit for intoxication.
shortSummary: A woman's car was hit by an object while driving under a highway overpass in Independence, prompting a police investigation.

argos_summary: A driver in Independence, Ohio, reported her car was hit by an unknown object under a highway overpass at 5:15 a.m. on July 26, shattering the windshield, but police found no suspects. The next day, a motorist was arrested for operating a vehicle impaired after speeding past a police cruiser, failing sobriety tests, and having a blood alcohol level nearly three times the legal limit. The blotter also highlighted other local incidents, including a stolen rental car citation and a drug possession arrest.
